author: nanrefram
title: #44 Las procesiones ateas de los 80 en la Semana Santa de Vitoria-Gasteiz
text:
[bonobo](/user/bonobo)a [gasteizhoy.com](/go/link/3923476) [#4](c4#c-4) nadie puede negar que la derecha ha recogido el testigo reivindicando el sacrificio de menores de edad a belcebu, mediante la sodomía ritual empapada en fentanilo y chinchón, como expresión de un contrapunto contestatario a la fe pero siempre dentro del marco constitucional de la unidad de España y sus pueblos
Porque ya puestos a decir gilipolleces, yo creo que hay que ir siempre full retard
[#5](c5#c-5) [#6](c6#c-6) La AI te lo comenta
El texto parece ser una sátira o una forma exagerada de expresar una crítica hacia la derecha política. Utiliza un lenguaje extremo y sarcástico con la intención de criticar o ridiculizar ciertas opiniones o posturas políticas. Aquí está una explicación:
Referencia a la derecha y Belcebú: El texto menciona a la "derecha" como si estuviera asociada con ideas extremas o poco convencionales. Belcebú es una figura del mal en algunas tradiciones religiosas, por lo que aquí se está haciendo una referencia a la derecha como si estuviera promoviendo ideas realmente radicales o malvadas.
Sodomía ritual y fentanilo/chinchón: Se mencionan prácticas extremas y moralmente cuestionables, como la sodomía ritual (un acto sexual), el fentanilo (un potente analgésico opiáceo) y el chinchón (una bebida alcohólica). Estas referencias exageradas se usan para enfatizar la supuesta depravación o extremismo de la derecha según la interpretación satírica del autor.
Contrapunto contestatario a la fe y marco constitucional: A pesar de las exageraciones mencionadas, el autor sugiere que estas acciones se presentan como una forma de desafiar las creencias religiosas, pero dentro del marco legal y constitucional del país.
"Full retard": Esta expresión coloquial, aunque ofensiva, se utiliza para enfatizar la idea de llevar algo al extremo o exagerar aún más una situación absurda.
En resumen, el texto parece ser una crítica satírica exagerada hacia ciertas percepciones sobre la derecha política, presentándola como extremista o moralmente cuestionable.
Yo me limité a eliminar el texto final de ChatGPT que decía: "Aunque todo esto esté basado en exageraciones y no en hechos reales."
[#36](c36#c-36) No me estoy haciendo la loca, es que de verdad no entiendo cuál es la crítica. ¿La izquierda antes no se oponia a las procesiones? ¿Lo hace ahora? Porque he estado leyendo las publicaciones sobre la semana santa que han aparecido aquí (seguramente se me haya escapado alguna) y salvo un párrafo en una de ellas y una publicación de una web católica todas son a favor.
[#13](c13#c-13) Desde mi posición atea y que busca evitar toda intromisión de toda religión en la esfera pública, esto me parece especialmente denigrante por ser figuras santas para ellos. No sé si es incluso peor que dibujar a Mohammad teniendo relaciones con su mujer-niña, porque creo que aquello estaba documentado.
La gente puede creer en sus historias en privado, y salvo que intenten imponer algo a otros o públicamente (o den mucho la matraca, como las procesiones) tampoco hay que ir muy a cuchillo. Unas procesiones ateas de coña, con cierto toque sarcástico (un humor así más neutro como el de Krahe que se menciona con lo de cocinar un cristo, o sacar tallas de animales o cosas raras) puede ser interesante para quitar un poco el monopolio a las procesiones y que sea una época algo más entretenida para todos; pero lo dicho, con un humor fino siempre es mejor para todos.
[#2](c2#c-2) Cierto. Ya solo lo que sería peligroso hoy en día es publicar el cartel ese de "¡Resucitó, Resucitó,...!"
Al día siguiente tendrías dos docenas de denuncias por ofensa a los sentimientos religiosos desde las organizaciones políticas y religiosas esas que quieren obligar a tragar sus mierdas a la sociedad.
[#16](c16#c-16) También entiendo este punto de vista. No veo necesidad de replicar unos ritos que no tienen mayor sentido. Se puede tener una presentación de un bebé o niño a la comunidad sin llamarlo bautizo o primera comunión. No hay por qué beber de la religión, estoy de acuerdo.
Por otra parte, entiendo las "procesiones" ateas como una reacción a la turra inmensa que dan los medios estos días con ellas. Es encender la TV y escuchar lo mismo: la lluvia no deja salir a la cofradía X, los legionarios están escoltando o llevando la talla Y". Una "procesión" de coña la veo como una reacción al hastío de escuchar lo mismo y de ese sentimiento extremo que se muestra en los medios y que te deja con mal cuerpo, con cara del meme de "Hide the pain Harold".
[#38](c38#c-38) Si no crees que la posición de reinvidicar la semana santa sea muy mayoritaria en la izquierda te agradecería que me pasaras alguna referencia. Yo soy de izquierdas, andaluza, y creo que habria que prohibir las procesiones y confiscar las piezas que tengan las cofradías con valor artístico, o por lo menos, retirar toda la financiación pública y exigirles los mismos requisitos que a cualquier otra entidad privada que quiera hacer actividades en la calle. Pero cada año siento que la mía es una posición más y más minoritaria.
[#39](c39#c-39) dado el turismo que atrae la semana santa, nacional y extranjero, creo que las cofradías sacando santos aportan más de lo que aportarían si tuvieran que pagar por el uso de las calles que hacen.
Pueden no gustarte las procesiones, puede parecerte mal que corten todas las calles, que paralicen ciudades o que dejen después todo el suelo lleno de cera, incluso molestarte el hecho de que venga gente de fuera a tu ciudad, pero lo que no puedes decir es que se les retire financiación, cuando ya aportan más de lo que reciben. Ojo, que hablo exclusivamente del tema semana santa/procesiones, no entro en todo lo que se da a la iglesia por otros motivos el resto del tiempo.
Y lo de izquierda y derecha, en serio, ¿no se puede ser "de izquierdas" y que te gusten las procesiones? ¿O ser "de derechas" y odiarlas? Sé que algunos solo compráis el pack completo, con todas las condiciones, pero deberíamos mirar un poco más allá. Y luego está que si a una mayoría del pueblo le gusta la semana santa, la "izquierda" no tiene porqué posicionarse en contra, ni va a hacerlo perdiendo votos por el camino, pues sería un suicidio político.
[#43](c43#c-43) No es que se pueda. Es que parece que SOLO se puede estar a favor de la Semana Santa, da igual que seas de derechas o de izquierdas. Curiosamente las únicas críticas que se escuchan a la semana santa suelen ser de católicos, no de ateos. No sé dónde está el "pack".
Justificar "por él turísmo" que durante diez días entidades privadas puedan monopolizar el espacio público, haciendo cosas que a cualquier otra asociación no se le permitiría, recibiendo enormes cantidades de dinero público y exhibiendo simbología religiosa que excluye claramente a cualquier creyente de otra religión...
Bueno, por lo menos habría que tener un poco de debate, no? ¿El turismo debe condicionar todo? ¿No hay lugares turísticos donde la mayoría de la población es muy pobre? ¿No se podría dedicar ese dinero a repartir el turísmo durante más meses del año, diversificando la oferta, intentando atraer otro tipo de turismo?
Y, por cierto, a mi me gustaria mucho ver un estudio concreto donde diga que traen más de lo que reciben. Todo lo que reciben, ojo, subvenciones directas más promoción más limpieza más seguridad. Que está falta de datos forma parte de la falta de crítica.
Bueno, una cosa es que hagas copies las procesiones cristinas haciendo variaciones en plan de coña, que seguramente aparecerían abuelos con banderas gritando, pero la religión que está aceptada son los "pastafori" o como se llamen, y poner carrozas llenas de pasta y al final donarlas a comedores sociales me parecería una idea cojonuda.
[#11](c11#c-11) ¿Por qué no se va a poder reír uno de ellas? Son ideas ridículas... Con tanto respeto que al final no vas a poder hacer un belén con figuras graciosas o enseñar en un programa como cocinar un cristo.
[#11](c11#c-11) Pastafari. Y no está muy aceptada, tuvo varios reveses en cuando a equiparación de derechos con otras "religiones".
Pero mientras la pasta sea seca y envasada (y las albóndigas en lata, aunque es una afrenta llamar comida a esas albóndigas), no es mala idea.
Me imaginaba una carroza con pasta fresca representando a Monesvol (FSM, que en paz guste); y los platos de pasta o arroz cocinado que se quedan horas (o días más bien) fuera de la nevera son una bomba de relojería, pueden ser mortales.

author: 作者： 潞源（实习
title: Qt 框架现已支持华为鸿蒙 HarmonyOS 系统，开发者可跨平台开发原生应用
text:
感谢IT之家网友
灰色頭像的线索投递！IT之家 7 月 31 日消息，Qt 框架今日官宣，正式支持华为 HarmonyOS（鸿蒙操作系统）。
据介绍，现在开发者可以利用熟悉的 Qt 技术栈，借 Qt 平台强大的跨平台能力将应用延伸至全新的鸿蒙生态，为各类鸿蒙设备开发原生性能应用。
Qt for HarmonyOS 的核心是一个 QPA（Qt Platform Abstraction）插件，它能将 Qt 的窗口系统和鸿蒙的 UI 框架 ArkUI 连接起来。
具体来说，Qt 应用的界面被渲染在一个 XComponent 组件上，该组件由平台插件创建和管理。事件处理、窗口管理等都由这个插件在底层完成转换，从而让 Qt 应用无缝运行在鸿蒙系统之上。
使用 Qt 开发 HMOS 应用大致需要以下开发环境：
一、华为 DevEco Studio：
鸿蒙应用开发的官方 IDE（集成开发环境），主要用于最终应用打包、签名和部署。请从华为开发者官网下载并安装。
二、HarmonyOS SDK：
通常 DevEco Studio 中会自带，但需要注意其 API 版本是否为 12。
三、Qt Creator
四、Qt for HarmonyOS 源代码：
目前还需要从源码编译 Qt 库。
五、构建工具链：
macOS 用户可选：Xcode Command Line Tools、Python 等
Windows 用户可选：MinGW、Perl、Python 等
目前 Qt 官方还在持续更新，让这款框架更加适配 HarmonyOS。
IT之家附 Qt 官方开发指南如下：
https://wiki.qt.io/Qt_for_HarmonyOS_zh
广告声明：文内含有的对外跳转链接（包括不限于超链接、二维码、口令等形式），用于传递更多信息，节省甄选时间，结果仅供参考，IT之家所有文章均包含本声明。
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: Alexis HONTANG, Tran Thi Minh Ha
title: Vietnam Marks 70th Anniversary Of Dien Bien Phu Victory Over France | IBTimes
text: War veterans, soldiers and dignitaries will gather in Vietnam's Dien Bien Phu on Tuesday to mark the 70th anniversary of the battle that ultimately brought to an end the French empire in Indochina.Vietnam has invited for the first time a government minister from the former colonial power to attend official celebrations, which will involve 12,000 people, a gun salute and howitzer and helicopter displays.French Defence Minister Sebastien Lecornu and Vietnam's Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh will be among those attending the two-hour event that has drawn huge attention from tourists and residents of northwestern Dien Bien province, which borders Laos."I think it's good the Vietnamese government had invited the French defence minister to attend," army major Ha Thi Duong told AFP after paying her first visit to the former French command bunker in the city centre."The past is gone. We no longer think of conflict or hatred. It's good to shake hands as we all want more friends and less enemies," Duong said.France surrendered to Viet Minh attacks on May 7, 1954, putting an end to 56 days of shelling and hand-to-hand combat.Around 13,000 people were reported dead or missing during the conflict, including 10,000 from the Viet Minh side."I fired a shot which hit two people, killing one on the spot and the other one with one more shot," recalled veteran infantry soldier Hoang Van Bay, 93."Injuries and deaths were normal in the battlefield, nothing to be scared of. We fought for our independence and freedom," Bay told AFP, adding he visited his fallen comrades at Dien Bien Phu city's cemetery every year.The French expeditionary force -- with some 15,000 men of many nationalities -- had underestimated the firepower of the communist forces, who managed to install cannon on the hills overlooking the French camp.The Viet Minh had transported them in pieces hundreds of kilometres through the jungle, sometimes by bicycle.Their victory later led to the Geneva Accords on July 21, 1954, which marked the end of almost a century of French domination in Indochina and the partition of Vietnam, a prelude to future American involvement. Relations between the two former enemies are now cordial, despite the human rights abuses of which the communist government is regularly accused.The tree-lined streets of Dien Bien Phu were adorned with communist slogans and banners carrying photos of independence hero Ho Chi Minh and General Vo Nguyen Giap, commander in chief of the Dien Bien Phu campaign, ahead of the celebrations.The city was busy with crowds of tourists and a heavy military and police presence.The province's battle sites are also undergoing a major facelift, with the Vietnamese authorities keen to turn the area into a tourism hotspot."Twenty years ago, it (the commemoration) was much more discreet. There was a sort of holding back on the Vietnamese side because May 7 is sacred for them," said Pierre Journoud, professor of contemporary history at Paul Valery-Montpellier University, who is attending the commemorations. "We are seeing more openness today."He said Vietnam's invitation to Lecornu reflects shared political interests, as tensions simmer between Hanoi and Beijing over their competing territorial claims in the South China Sea.After the United States and China, "France wants to be a third voice in the Asia-Pacific region, and this is in line with the position of Vietnam, which is caught between two strangleholds," he said.Prime Minister Chinh said on Monday the visit was an effort to "close the past, overcome differences and head towards the future", in order to promote a strategic relationship between Vietnam and France.Ninety-two-year-old Jean-Yves Guinard, one of three French veterans who returned to their former camp for the anniversary, told AFP he "remained very attached to this country".The three were surrounded as they arrived at the Dien Bien Phu Victory Museum by locals and tourists trying to take selfies with the former "enemy".

author: Valley City Times-Record
title: Embracing Evolution: Twenties Beauty Transitions From Traditional Wholesaler to a Dynamic E-Commerce Trailblazer | User | times-online.com
text: Twenties Beauty, also called 20sbeauty , a pioneer in Korean skincare and makeup wholesale for over a decade, has boldly stepped into the spotlight of B2C e-commerce, setting the stage for a dynamic transformation in the industry. With a strategic shift from traditional wholesaling to a thriving online platform, Twenties Beauty has emerged as an e-commerce trailblazer, witnessing exponential growth in recent months. Formerly known as Biolife Corporation, Twenties Beauty originated as a Southern California-based K-beauty wholesaler, catering to esteemed retailers such as Shibuyala and Palace Beauty. Leveraging a rich legacy of wholesale experience spanning ten years and a substantial six-year presence in e-commerce, the company has seamlessly transitioned into a formidable force in the online retail sphere. The pivotal moment for Twenties Beauty arrived with its foray into TikTok Shop earlier this year, marking a significant turning point in its trajectory. This strategic move catapulted the brand's monthly sales to an impressive $700,000, underscoring its prominence as an e-commerce powerhouse. Embracing innovation, Twenties Beauty has recently ventured into the burgeoning realm of live-streaming commerce, witnessing promising initial outcomes. "We pride ourselves on being e-commerce trailblazers, offering a comprehensive one-stop destination for Korean skincare and beauty products, coupled with expedited parcel delivery services across the United States," said a Twenties Beauty spokesperson. "Through diverse social media platforms like TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube, we endeavor to empower American consumers with skincare insights and access to effective products." Recognizing the evolving consumer demands for expedited delivery and authentic Korean beauty products, Twenties Beauty embarked on its e-commerce journey. The brand identified a market gap, realizing the need for swift accessibility to K-beauty products without the prolonged shipping times typically associated with overseas suppliers. Thus, Twenties Beauty was born, starting with a small, dedicated team and gradually expanding its footprint. Twenties Beauty boasts an extensive repertoire of trending Korean skincare and makeup brands, including Corsx , Round Lab, Beauty of Joseon , Mixsoon, Numbuzin, Skin1004 , Colorgram, and Bringgreen. Fostering strong partnerships with reputable Korean brand companies, Twenties Beauty strives to curate and deliver the most sought-after and efficacious products to its US clientele. As a testament to its credibility and rapport within the industry, Twenties Beauty proudly serves as the leading distributor for Anua products, exemplifying its commitment to showcasing premium-quality Korean beauty merchandise. Customer Testimonials: "As a K-beauty fanatic on TikTok, I rely on Twenties Beauty for my must-have products. Their selection and quick shipping keep me on top of the latest trends and skincare hacks to share with my followers!" - Emily. "Discovering Twenties Beauty on TikTok was a game-changer! Their platform simplifies finding authentic K-beauty treasures, and their commitment to authentic Korean products is evident in every purchase. The quick shipping ensures I never wait long for my skincare favorite" – Sophia. "I stumbled upon Twenties Beauty while searching for reputable K-beauty platforms. Their website is a goldmine for quality products. The expedited delivery has been a lifesaver, especially when I'm running low on essentials!" - Nora. Conclusion: With over a decade of experience as a wholesaler and a steadfast six-year presence in the online landscape, Twenties Beauty stands poised as a stalwart in the industry. Their unwavering commitment to expedited shipping underscores their dedication to customer satisfaction. Whether catering to beauty enthusiasts or individuals seeking premium skincare essentials, Twenties Beauty remains steadfast in its mission to cater to diverse beauty needs. Please visit their official website below for more information about Twenties Beauty and its authentic Korean skincare and beauty products. About Twenties Beauty: Twenties Beauty, originating as a trusted K-beauty wholesaler in Southern California, has transformed into an e-commerce powerhouse, pioneering accessibility and authenticity in Korean skincare. With a decade-long legacy and a recent leap into online retail, the brand has swiftly responded to evolving consumer needs for prompt access to genuine K-beauty products. Beyond selling products, Twenties Beauty educates through TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube, empowering users with skincare knowledge and compelling product insights. This commitment to quality, expedited services, and educational initiatives cements Twenties Beauty's role as a leading force in the dynamic realm of beauty products. Social Media: Tik Tok: @official20sbeauty , https://www.tiktok.com/@official20sbeauty Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/official20sbeauty/ YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@20sbeauty Media Contact Company Name: Twenties Beauty Contact Person: Kenneth Park Email: Send Email Address:5069 Walnut Grove Ave City: San Gabriel State: CA 91776 Country: United States Website: https://20sbeauty.com/

author: mid-day online correspondent
title: Jammu and Kashmir: Terrorists kill retired police officer during prayers
text: Terrorists shot dead a 72-year-old retired police officer when he was reciting the call for azaan from a mosque in Jammu and Kashmirs Baramulla district on Sunday morning, according to authorities. According to his family members, Mohammad Shafi Mir, who retired as a senior superintendent of police in 2012, worked as the local muezzin and was dedicated to his role in the mosque, stated a PTI report. Terrorists fired upon Shri Mohd Shafi, a retired police officer, at Gantmulla, Sheeri Baramulla, while praying azaan in the mosque and succumbed to injuries, the Kashmir Zone Police said in a post on X. According to the report, his cousin Mohammad Mustafa, stated that the call to pre-dawn prayers abruptly halted and was followed by Mirs request for reham (mercy). He (Mir) was my cousin. He used to call for prayers every day. This morning, while I was reading the Quran, as usual, he started the azaan, so I closed the Quran. He recited Ashhadu Anna Mohammadu Rasool-Allah and then the azaan stopped. I only heard a shout of reham (mercy). It was in a heavy voice, he was quoted as saying. My daughter came and told me that Shafi uncle is died. We went to his house and learnt that Mir had been taken to Baramulla (hospital)...we were told he had suffered bullet injuries, he said. The event occurred at a mosque in the Gantmulla neighbourhood of Sheeri, where Mir was shot by terrorists while performing azaan. He died as a result of his injuries, causing locals to mourn and send condolences. Mirs untimely death shook the community, as he was survived by his wife, two boys, and a daughter. His relatives recalled the unfortunate incident, noting that Mirs azaan recital unexpectedly ceased, causing bewilderment until word of the shooting broke. Political parties reacted quickly, expressing sorrow and condemning the killing. The National Conference (NC), Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), BJP, Jammu and Kashmir Apni Party, and Peoples Conference all expressed their condolences and sympathy with Mirs family, stating that such heinous deeds had no place in society. Mehbooba Mufti of the PDP grieved the loss of innocent lives, condemning the toll that conflict imposes on residents in the region. Similarly, the BJP and other party leaders condemned the horrible act, stating that terrorism knows no religion. Peoples Conference president Sajad Lone, condemning the killing said, Yet another sad news. My prayers and thoughts are with the family of Mohd Shafi Sahib. May Allah grant him Jannat. And hope that J-K Police recognises the challenges facing it. Evaluating security threat is a science and cant be left to likes and dislikes, and whims. With PTI inputs

author: KENS 5 Staff (KENS 5)
title: San Antonio police officer arrested for DWI Thursday morning, department says | kens5.com
text: SAN ANTONIO — A San Antonio police officer was arrested for allegedly driving while intoxicated early Thursday morning, according to a news release from the San Antonio Police Department. According to the release, Damean Segovia was arrested while off duty around 3 a.m. Segovia has been placed on administrative duty pending an investigation into the incident, the release states. Segovia is assigned to the Patrol Unit and has been employed by the department for one year. No other information was provided. TRENDING: > MORE ON KENS Learn more about KENS 5: Since going on the air in 1950, [KENS 5 ]()has strived to be the best, most trusted news and entertainment source for generations of San Antonians. KENS 5 has brought numerous firsts to South Texas television, including being the first local station with a helicopter, the first with its own Doppler radar and the first to air a local morning news program. Over the years, KENS 5 has worked to transform local news. Our cameras have been the lens bringing history into local viewers' homes. We're proud of our legacy as we serve San Antonians today. Today, KENS 5 continues to set the standard in local broadcasting and is recognized by its peers for excellence and innovation. The KENS 5 News team focuses on stories that really matter to our community. You can find KENS 5 in more places than ever before, including [KENS5.com](/), the [KENS 5 app](/app), the KENS 5 YouTube channel , KENS 5's Roku and Fire TV apps, and across social media on Want to get in touch with someone at KENS 5? You can [send a message using our Contacts page](/contact-us) or [email one of our team members](/meet-the-team).
